title: Organize tasks
content:
Task: Create a structured TODO system for code quality improvements with maximum future agent efficiency.

Folder Structure:
TODOS/code-quality-improvements/
├── [task files]
└── completed/

Filename Convention:
[P{1-3}][{Type}][B:{Benefit}|C:{Complexity}]{task-name}.md

Example:
[P2][Enhancement][B:Medium|C:Low]configuration-override-security.md

Types: Enhancement, Fix, Security, Performance, Polish
Benefits: Minimal, Low, Medium, High, Highest

Complexity Scale:
- Quickfix: Single file, 5-20 lines, high certainty of one-try success, simple logic
- Low: Single file or new simple file, 20-100 lines, straightforward logic, low breaking risk
- Medium: 1-3 files, 100-300 lines, moderate logic complexity, some integration points, medium breaking risk
- High: Multiple files, 300+ lines, complex logic/algorithms, multiple integration points, higher breaking risk
- Highest: Major refactoring, complex algorithms, cross-system dependencies, high breaking risk

File Template:
# [Title]
## Priority: P{X} | Type: {Type} | Benefit: {Level} | Complexity: {Level}

## Problem Description
[Clear problem statement with context]

## Implementation Plan
[Step-by-step technical approach]

## File Locations
[Specific files and line numbers from codebase]

## Success Criteria
[Concrete completion indicators]

## Dependencies
[Prerequisites: format as [Depends-On: taskname] if applicable]

## Code Examples
[Relevant code snippets showing current state and proposed changes]

## Reminder
Move this file to TODOS/code-quality-improvements/completed/ when implementation is finished.
